column4: type "dmesg | wlan0" onterminal and look msg form your wireless card
sorry "dmesg | grep wlan0"
ok what info am looking for?
look if u find something like "wlan0 deauthenticating from by local choice (reason=3)" or some like this
yes that line is there
and after that u find "authenticated" and " associated with.."?
but now work wireless?
yes now it works but it will stop some time soon
maybe is the ipv6 that give u some problem.. try to disable it
Ipv6 settings method is set to ignore is it disabled?
type this on terminal "cat /proc/sys/net/ipv6/conf/all/disable_ipv6 " if the result is 1 is disable
result is 0
set /proc/sys/net/ipv6/conf/all/disable_ipv6 1 is it the right command?
the right command is this "cat /proc/sys/net/ipv6/conf/all/disable_ipv6" :)
but is only for see if is enabel
oh ok :), how to change it?

for disable type "sudo gedit /etc/sysctl.conf" and at the end of file add this line "net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 = 1" "net.ipv6.conf.default.disable_ipv6 = 1" "net.ipv6.conf.lo.disable_ipv6 = 1" copy the 3 lines without ""
Done, but the "cat /proc/sys/net/ipv6/conf/all/disable_ipv6" still shows 0
u have to reboot your pc first
and after if u look it have to be 1
oh :) of course :p thanks brb i hope
I hope it work :)
now it is disabled just have to wait to see if it works :)
